verses.verse: Wisdom <S%H2454><s%> has built <S%H1129><s%> her house. <S%H1004><s%> She has carved out <S%H2672><s%> her seven <S%H7651><s%> pillars. <S%H5982><s%>
She has prepared <S%H2873><s%> her meat. <S%H2874><s%> She has mixed <S%H4537><s%> her wine. <S%H3196><s%> She has also set <S%H6186><s%> her table. <S%H7979><s%>
She has sent out <S%H7971><s%> her maidens. <S%H5291><s%> She cries <S%H7121><s%> from <S%H1610><s%> the highest places <S%H4791><s%> of the city: <S%H7176><s%>
"Whoever is simple, <S%H6612><s%> let him turn in <S%H5493><s%> here! <S%H2638><s%>" As for him who is void of understanding, <S%H3820><s%> she says to him, <S%H559><s%>
"Come, <S%H3212><s%> eat <S%H3898><s%> some of my bread, <S%H3899><s%> Drink <S%H8354><s%> some of the wine <S%H3196><s%> which I have mixed! <S%H4537><s%>
Leave <S%H5800><s%> your simple <S%H6612><s%> ways, <S%H2421><s%> and live. Walk <S%H833><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> of understanding. <S%H998><s%>"
He who corrects <S%H3256><s%> a mocker <S%H3887><s%> invites <S%H3947><s%> insult. <S%H7036><s%> He who reproves <S%H3198><s%> a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man invites abuse. <S%H3971><s%>
Don't <S%H3198><s%> reprove a scoffer, <S%H3887><s%> lest he hate <S%H8130><s%> you. <S%H3198><s%> Reprove a wise man, <S%H2450><s%> and he will love you. <S%H157><s%>

Instruct <S%H5414><s%> a wise <S%H2450><s%> man, <S%H2450><s%> and he will be still wiser. Teach <S%H3045><s%> a righteous <S%H6662><s%> man, <S%H3254><s%> and he will increase in learning. <S%H3948><s%>
The fear <S%H3374><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is the beginning <S%H8462><s%> of wisdom. <S%H2451><s%> The knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One is understanding. <S%H998><s%>
For by me your days <S%H3117><s%> will be multiplied. <S%H7235><s%> The years <S%H8141><s%> of your life <S%H2416><s%> will be increased. <S%H3254><s%>
If you are wise, <S%H2449><s%> you are wise <S%H2449><s%> for yourself. <S%H3887><s%> If you mock, you alone will bear it. <S%H5375><s%>
The foolish <S%H3687><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> is loud, <S%H1993><s%> Undisciplined, <S%H6615><s%> and <S%H1077><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> nothing. <S%H4100><s%>
She sits <S%H3427><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house, <S%H1004><s%> on a seat <S%H3678><s%> in the high places <S%H4791><s%> of the city, <S%H7176><s%>
To call <S%H7121><s%> to those who pass <S%H5674><s%> by, <S%H3474><s%> who go straight on their ways, <S%H734><s%>
"Whoever is simple, <S%H6612><s%> let him turn in <S%H5493><s%> here. <S%H2638><s%>" as for him who is void of understanding, <S%H3820><s%> she says to him, <S%H559><s%>
"Stolen <S%H1589><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> is sweet. <S%H4985><s%> Food <S%H3899><s%> eaten in secret <S%H5643><s%> is pleasant. <S%H5276><s%>"
But he doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know that the dead <S%H7496><s%> are there, <S%H7121><s%> that her guests are in the depths <S%H6012><s%> of Sheol. <S%H7585><s%>
